p: Different Pinus species differ in their susceptibility to PWN [ 5, 14, 32, 33, 38]. In this study, we targeted 21 species ( Table 1) evaluated as “susceptible” by Mamiya [ 14] or Evans [ 5], or “susceptible” to “highly susceptible” by Nakamura and Tabata [ 39]. Next, we evaluated the PWD risk within their native distribution areas as proposed by Critchfield and Little [ 40]. The set of distribution information was manually digitized and stored in geographical information systems (GISs; Fig 1).
